Class Evaluation

Main entry point for the testplan to interact with the judge.

This class provides access to all relevant information and allows setting various options.

All documented properties and methods (that are not internal or private) are part of the testplan API and can safely be used.

Hierarchy

  • Evaluation
  • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:396
Index

Accessors

acceleration actionTimeout answers eventAcceleration group groupedOutput log out output scheduler timeAcceleration turboMode vm

Accessors

acceleration

  • set acceleration(factor: number): void

  • Set the acceleration factor.

    The Scratch VM will run at 60 FPS by default. This means every 16 or so ms a new step is taken. This factor allows changing this with a certain factor.

    This will adjust all time-related parameters with the same factor. For example, timeouts will also be affected by the factor. If you don't want this, you can use the eventAcceleration and timeAcceleration properties to override this.

    Note that the factor is applied on a best-efforts basis, meaning it cannot do magic. The VM cannot run faster than the time needed to calculate in each step. For example, if a step takes 8ms to run, any factor above 2 will have no additional speedup.

    Once execution of the Scratch project has begun, you can no longer change this value.

    Parameters

    • factor: number

      The factor, e.g. 2 will double the speed.

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:527

actionTimeout

  • set actionTimeout(timeout: number): void

  • Set the action timeout for the scheduler.

    When waiting for some event to occur or for some action to complete, this is the maximal waiting time. If the event does not occur or the action does not complete, the judge will error with a timeout error.

    Once execution of the Scratch project has begun, you can no longer change this value.

    This value is affected by the acceleration.

    Parameters

    • timeout: number

      The timeout in milliseconds.

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:499

answers

  • get answers(): string[]

  • Get the array of answers.

    Returns string[]

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:434
  • set answers(answers: string[]): void

  • Set the array of answers to provide to the submission.

    These will be used if the Scratch project asks for input from the user.

    Parameters

    • answers: string[]

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:443

eventAcceleration

  • set eventAcceleration(factor: number): void

  • Override the acceleration factor for the Scratch waiting times.

    By default, waiting times in the scheduler are affected by the acceleration. This property allows you to override this.

    The same caveats apply as for the acceleration property. Additionally, this should not be set higher than the acceleration, as this can create weird situations.

    This will be used to set the timeouts for the scheduled events.

    Parameters

    • factor: number

      The factor, e.g. 2 will double the speed.

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:570

  • Deprecated

    Use the out property.

    Returns GroupLevel

  • get log(): Log

  • Get the log instance.

    Note that how filled the log will be depends on which phase the test is in.

    Returns Log

  • Get the convenience functions to create groups and tests.

scheduler

  • get scheduler(): ScheduledEvent

  • Get the event scheduler.

    In most cases, this is useless outside the during execution phase.

    Returns ScheduledEvent

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:480

timeAcceleration

  • set timeAcceleration(factor: number): void

  • Override the acceleration factor for the Scratch waiting times.

    By default, waiting times in Scratch (e.g. wait for blocks) are affected by the acceleration. This property allows you to override this.

    The same caveats apply as for the acceleration property. Additionally, this should not be set higher than the acceleration, as this can create weird situations.

    Once execution of the Scratch project has begun, you can no longer change this value.

    Parameters

    • factor: number

      The factor, e.g. 2 will double the speed.

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:550

turboMode

  • set turboMode(enabled: boolean): void

  • Enables or disabled turbo mode.

    This uses the built-in Scratch turbo mode. If an exercise supports it, you should probably enable this, as it can result in significant speedups.

    Parameters

    • enabled: boolean

    Returns void

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:582

vm

  • get vm(): "scratch-vm".default

  • Get access to the Scratch VM itself.

    In most cases, you should avoid manipulating the VM directly.

    For reading data, it is preferred to use the log, however, direct access to the VM can be useful in the during execution phase.

    Writing data should not be done. This might result in an unstable VM.

    Returns "scratch-vm".default

    • Defined in packages/core/src/evaluation.ts:427
